content.text:
I'm ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans. I understand that I'm operating in READ-ONLY mode and cannot modify, create, or delete any files.

Let me start by understanding the current state of the repository:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /app && pwd</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="timeout">5000</parameter>
<invoke name="view_file">
<parameter name="path">/app</parameter>
</invoke>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /app && ls -la</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="timeout">5000</parameter>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /app && find . -type f -name "*.json" -o -name "*.md" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="timeout">5000</parameter>

I'm warmed up and ready! I can see this is a git repository with some untracked files including `.claude.json` and directories like `projects/`, `shell-snapshots/`, `statsig/`, and `todos/`.

I'm prepared to:
- Explore the codebase using Read, Glob, Grep, and read-only Bash commands
- Understand existing patterns and architecture
- Design implementation plans based on requirements you provide
- Apply any specific perspective you assign me
- Provide detailed implementation strategies with critical file lists

What requirements would you like me to explore and plan for?
